CONCEPT.LABEL: entity
CONCEPT.DEF: Something which exists independently of others.

CONCEPT.LABEL: quality_1
CONCEPT.DEF:
The concept "quality" does not appear under this type. Instead, "property" corresponds to the conventional "quality".
It cannot exist alone but always exists dependently on physical things which also need qualities to exist.

CONCEPT.LABEL: space
CONCEPT.DEF: When it is used as a class constraint, it has to be taken "p-space", that is, its subspace(part of the space) is almost equivalent to its subclass. <Kobe is part of Japan>, but <Kobe is-a Japan> is valid as well in the context of region.

CONCEPT.LABEL: 3D space
CONCEPT.DEF: 3D spaceR is a subspace and hence it is part-of 3D space. At the same time, 3D spaceR inherits everything from the class constraint: 3D space.

SLOT.label: slot7
SLOT.DEF: 3D spaceR is a subspace and hence it is part-of 3D space. At the same time, 3D spaceR inherits everything from the class constraint: 3D space.

CONCEPT.LABEL: substrate
CONCEPT.DEF: This needs further elaboration. Anyway, this is what entities need to exist in the real world.

CONCEPT.LABEL: Time
CONCEPT.DEF: Much more sophisticated ontology of time has been developed but is not included here. Please contact Mizoguchi if you are interested in it.

CONCEPT.LABEL: Clock time
CONCEPT.DEF: time point

CONCEPT.LABEL: object
CONCEPT.DEF:
It is unitary, that is, it exists as a whole.
It needs substance to construct itself. It needs an event in which it participates to exist in the real world.

CONCEPT.LABEL: physical
CONCEPT.DEF:
It needs both 3D space and time to exist.
Quality role type is defined here as a role, associated with physical, played by generic quality. "quality instance" is defined as role-holder. In order to refer to quality role type, use "#quality instance". See "human".

SLOT.label: slot
SLOT.DEF: This is a definition of quality role type at the highest abstraction level. All the quality roles defined in the context of all the subclasses of entity automatically become sub-type of this quality role type. See human in which height is defined.

SUB_L.label: slot
SUB_L.def: This is a definition of quality role type at the highest abstraction level. All the quality roles defined in the context of all the subclasses of entity automatically become sub-type of this quality role type. See human in which height is defined.

CONCEPT.LABEL: Topological whole
CONCEPT.DEF: Its identity is tightly dependent on the topological relations between constituents.

CONCEPT.LABEL: morphological whole
CONCEPT.DEF: It looses its identity when its shape(morpheme) is damaged.

CONCEPT.LABEL: group
CONCEPT.DEF:
The concrete version of set which is abstract.
Its identity is determined by its members, that is, if all the member are same, then it keeps its identity, and if the group is same, then the members are same.

CONCEPT.LABEL: functional
CONCEPT.DEF: It looses its identity when its function is damaged.

CONCEPT.LABEL: living organism
CONCEPT.DEF: Its function is to do life activity.

CONCEPT.LABEL: artifact
CONCEPT.DEF:
Its function is given inherently(when it is born).
It means not only "man-made thing" but also "agent-made thing" including bird nests.

CONCEPT.LABEL: representing thing
CONCEPT.DEF:
This is a physical thing which has "representation" as its part like a copy of a book you can hold. The physical part of "representation form" is put on the medium, and hence the thing becomes a concrete thing. See Book for detail.
Note that you can copy "representation by symbols" only after it has become "represented thing". That is, what you can copy is what's on the medium, not representation itself which is a semi-abstract thing. This doesn't apply to 2D representation. See painting.

SLOT.label: slot
SLOT.DEF: What's on the medium is usually the image part of representation form.

CONCEPT.LABEL: non-representing thing
CONCEPT.DEF: Ordinary artifacts. Its subclasses are not elaborated yet.

SUB_L.label: 非表現物
SUB_L.def: 普通の人工物

CONCEPT.LABEL: agent
CONCEPT.DEF: It looses its identity when its mind is damaged.

CONCEPT.LABEL: complex agent
CONCEPT.DEF: This is defined as what enacts the external behavior such as decision making. See [Galton 2009] in detail.

CONCEPT.LABEL: organization
CONCEPT.DEF: It has controllable intention.

CONCEPT.LABEL: robot
CONCEPT.DEF: It is kind of joke. Robot is definitely an artifact. But, th

SUB_L.class_const: プログラムされた精神

CONCEPT.LABEL: book
CONCEPT.DEF:
This has a publisher but doesn't have authors which belong to abstract book which is the thing written by authors.
See abstract book.
A book as a represented thing is what you see on the medium(paper or electronic file) as a sequence of icons of characters which constitute the whole text. The book as representation is composed of the sequence of abstract symbols denoted by those icons of characters.

SUB_L.class_const: アルファベットの線画像

CONCEPT.LABEL: stative
CONCEPT.DEF: State-based thing

CONCEPT.LABEL: process_1
CONCEPT.DEF:
A unit of process. The nested structure of processes are built(modeled) using the idea of functional decomposition. See [Kitamura 2006] in detail.
Essentially open-ended(non-anchored) and time-dependent. By open-ended, I mean neither its beginning nor its termination are sepcified, and hence it is homogeneous(any part of it is the same process). Therefore, a process cannot exist in the real world as an independent one. It necessarily exists associated with an event. <Its instance is put into an event instance to exist in the real world.>
Although it has a time interval to specify in what time region it exists, both ends of the interval are excluded, that is, the interval is an open interval.
Processes are material of events.
Linguistically, it corresponds to verbs, while events to nouns. Consider: to travel and a travel.

SLOT.label: slot
SLOT.DEF: Just before the intiated time

SLOT.label: slot3
SLOT.DEF: Just after the terninal time

CONCEPT.LABEL: phenomena
CONCEPT.DEF: No doer. Participants only.

CONCEPT.LABEL: physical action
CONCEPT.DEF: Actions for physical objects.

SUB_L.label: 物理的行為
SUB_L.def: use body

CONCEPT.LABEL: action
CONCEPT.DEF:
It needs an intention of the doer.
Needless to say, since this is a subclass of process, every instance of this class must be a proces rather than an event. Therefore, it exists in an open time interval: (s-time, e-time).

CONCEPT.LABEL: cognitive action
CONCEPT.DEF: Actions in the brain

SUB_L.label: 認知行為
SUB_L.def: use brain

CONCEPT.LABEL: actor achievement action
CONCEPT.DEF: A state of the actor is achieved.

CONCEPT.LABEL: abstract
CONCEPT.DEF: It needs neither time nor sapce to exist.

CONCEPT.LABEL: intrinsic generic quality
CONCEPT.DEF: Essential attribute in a common term.

CONCEPT.LABEL: accidental generic quality
CONCEPT.DEF: non-essential generic quality. There is no clear boundary between intrinsic and accidental generic qualities in theory.

CONCEPT.LABEL: unit
CONCEPT.DEF:
It is not The unit that has its own size but a kind of dimension, that is, axis representing kind of quantity. m,cm,Km, etc. are units for representation. Quantity must be representation-independent. See value slot of singleton quantity and "unit-related form".
This is a simplified version and should be elaborated more.

CONCEPT.LABEL: length
CONCEPT.DEF: Note that its two slots are not p/o slots but a/o slots. This is because their slot values inher in its instance. Furthermore, they are not values themselves but are referring to "length quantity" defined elsewhere. This nicely prevents length instance from being a length quantity. This is very important for generic quality to play quality role. Therefore, there are many instances of length referring to 10cm long, while there is only ONE 10cm long as a quantity in the world.

CONCEPT.LABEL: color
CONCEPT.DEF:
Color as a kind is a generic quality. Red is a subclass of color and/or a value of color as discussed below, and being red is a property of things. The differentiation between red as a value of color and being red as a property is critical. In summary, there are three kinds of red.
It is unary rather than binary just like ordinary classes such as animal, car, etc.

CONCEPT.LABEL: role
CONCEPT.DEF:
Roles are not adequately reflected in YAMATO, since it is already reflected/imbedded in Hozo tool. While ordinary types such as human, table, etc. are defined independently, roles are defined within a context which they necessarily depends on in our role theory [Mizoguchi 07]. In fact, roles are used in defining all the types in YAMATO. These are the reasons why YAMATO does not have to incorporate roles in it. When one uses Hozo with YAMATO, he/she can enjoy maximally the benefits presented by both.
See [Mizoguchi 2007] Mizoguchi R., Sunagawa E., Kozaki K. and Kitamura Y.: A Model of Roles within an Ontology Development Tool: Hozo, J. of Applied Ontology, Vol.2, No.2, pp.159-179. Sep. 2007.

SLOT.label: slot
SLOT.DEF: Role depends on its context.

CONCEPT.LABEL: proposition
CONCEPT.DEF: This is the body of the content which can be represented in terms of symbols.

CONCEPT.LABEL: fact
CONCEPT.DEF: A happening which is what a human has recognized, that is, the content of the happening which can be explained by the person. The fact itself is an instance of event.

CONCEPT.LABEL: designed proposition
CONCEPT.DEF: It is essentially a specification for the production phase(mode) which theoretically follows it and uses it as specification.

CONCEPT.LABEL: product proposition
CONCEPT.DEF: It is directly consumed by endusers. The reason why "action" which includes "productive action" is used is to allow such cases where it is used as a specification. For example, a user might use a novel as specification of how to write a novel.

CONCEPT.LABEL: plan
CONCEPT.DEF: Specification for execution.

CONCEPT.LABEL: piece of music
CONCEPT.DEF: This is specification of how to play it.

CONCEPT.LABEL: specification
CONCEPT.DEF: This is essentially what should be realized using it as specification.

CONCEPT.LABEL: painting
CONCEPT.DEF: paintings without a canvas. (see painting_2) This corresponds to what you can see in computer-captured paintings. It still needs canvas to be a perfect individual in the real world.

CONCEPT.LABEL: primitive representation
CONCEPT.DEF:
Primitive representation is defined as something composed of representation form and proposition carried by the representation form.
The identity exists in its proposition. Although it has another identity as a symbol sequence, it is possessed by its representation form. It is similar to human and human body.

CONCEPT.LABEL: representation by symbol
CONCEPT.DEF: Representation in terms of symbols.

CONCEPT.LABEL: 2D representation
CONCEPT.DEF:
Because there is no content denoted/carried by symbols, 2D representation except symbol figure is equivalent to representation form. Both degenerated into one. In other words, representation form itself is the content in the case of 2D representation except symbol figure.
It still needs medium to exist in the real world as a physical entity. It is not very concrete because it is not yet drawn on a canvas or the like with paint or ink.

CONCEPT.LABEL: musical score
CONCEPT.DEF: Something composed of musical symbol sequence carrying the specification of how to play it as its content.

CONCEPT.LABEL: text
CONCEPT.DEF: Sequence of sentences

CONCEPT.LABEL: utterance
CONCEPT.DEF: Label is not perfect. It is not a speech-coded yet.

CONCEPT.LABEL: representation form
CONCEPT.DEF: This is what is left after extracting its meaning/content from "representation". The heart of this conceptualization is the separation between form and content.

CONCEPT.LABEL: image form
CONCEPT.DEF: Because there is no symbol for image, still image is equivalent to 2D representation(painting). Both are degenerated into one. It is not very concrete because it is not yet drawn on a canvas or the like with paint or ink. So, taking line images, they are line figures without ink.

CONCEPT.LABEL: natural language
CONCEPT.DEF:
Not language as a kind but language sentence excluding its meaning.
The style of sentence is its content.

CONCEPT.LABEL: unit of length
CONCEPT.DEF: Down to this level, units represent intrinsic nature of unit as a "dimension". Those units lower than this level, such as, m, cm, etc. are those for representation of the corresponding quantities. That is, both "100cm and 1m represents the same quantity. What is essential to the quantity is a quantity of length. See "representation form".

SLOT.label: slot
SLOT.DEF: This space should be "p-space", since the class constraints of the slots of the subclasses of "location" must be not its subclass but its part.

CONCEPT.LABEL: Universal
CONCEPT.DEF:
By this, I mean not classes unlike other researchers say which make little sense since they duplicate with the is-a structure of Particulars, but mean concepts which appear in our domain of discourse such as Concept, Instance, State, etc.
This is not seriously elaborated yet.

CONCEPT.LABEL: Instance
CONCEPT.DEF: Every instrance is an instance of this class(Instance).

CONCEPT.LABEL: Concept
CONCEPT.DEF: It corresponds to(counter part of) Instance.

CONCEPT.LABEL: symbol
CONCEPT.DEF:
Definition of the figure of a symbol which vertually exists. At the same time, this corresponds to the symbol itself.
Theoretically, a symbol is defined as anything which is identified among other symbols and designates some particular thing.

CONCEPT.LABEL: "a"
CONCEPT.DEF: This is an instance of alphabet class. The alphabet "a" as an instance of alphabet class exists only ONE in the world. Many "a"s you see are instances of "a" as representation. The content of a symbol, which is being represented by a visible symbol(icon) is inherently invisible. What is visible is a symbol figure which represents the symbol. Although this statement is true, it is rather troublesome to deal with symbols like such. So, we could assume that the invisible symbol is degenerated to (equivalent to) the ideal figure of the symbol which is also invisible because it virtually exists.

CONCEPT.LABEL: tale of Genji as content
CONCEPT.DEF: This is the tale of Genji which is equivalent to the content slot of tale of Genji(instance) as sentence.

SUB_L.label: 源氏物語の内容(インスタンス)

CONCEPT.LABEL: property
CONCEPT.DEF:
This is an abstration of a generic quality taking a quality value. This roughly corrensponds to the conventional "quality", though the definition of quality in YAMATO is a quality role associated with an entity played by a generic quality such as "height of a person".
Quality must be free from any particular quality value to cope with its change along time. Precicely speaking, "height of a person" is a qualityrole type and "height of John" is a quality. "John's height of 160cm at time t1" is a quality instance.
This term(property) is used mainly for description of quality rather than ontology of quality.
The notion of property is consistent with "state" which does NOT compatible with quality type. Consider "hungry" which is compatible with "tall" rather than "length".

SLOT.label: slot2
SLOT.DEF: Property is derived from a quality value. This slot referrs to the original quantity.

CONCEPT.LABEL: being red
CONCEPT.DEF:
Quality of being red. It is qualitative and is different from red, a subclass of color, which is a generic quality.
See color, red and being long.

CONCEPT.LABEL: blue
CONCEPT.DEF: See red.

CONCEPT.LABEL: continuous action
CONCEPT.DEF: Once activated, the action is being performed all the time during the whole active interval.

CONCEPT.LABEL: meta action
CONCEPT.DEF: Action about action.

CONCEPT.LABEL: stative_2
CONCEPT.DEF: Stative_2 is essentially instant-based and is specified at the limit of the shrinking time interval.

CONCEPT.LABEL: situation
CONCEPT.DEF: state of affairs=interaction patterns among participants as well as their external states

CONCEPT.LABEL: state
CONCEPT.DEF: Location-independent. State corresponds not to generic quality but to property. It is possessed by continuants and processes.

CONCEPT.LABEL: internal state
CONCEPT.DEF: state of the actor ?internal-state is internal of ?holder.

CONCEPT.LABEL: external state
CONCEPT.DEF: non-internal state of the actor object

CONCEPT.LABEL: substance
CONCEPT.DEF: Not amount of matter but just chemical existence.

CONCEPT.LABEL: water
CONCEPT.DEF: H2O. Not amount of water which is non-unitary continuant.

CONCEPT.LABEL: Particular
CONCEPT.DEF: Ordinary top-most type.

CONCEPT.LABEL: Any
CONCEPT.DEF: Relations are organized in another world. Hozo deals with relations and the wholeness concepts (ordinary types) in different worlds. Similarly to Roles, YAMATO implemented in Hozo exploits built-in and user-defined relations. Hozo has three built-in relations: is-a, part-of and attribute-of which are exploited to define types in YAMATO. These are used to introduce fundamental definitions of types, and user-defined relations are used to impose semantic constraints among parts and attributes of a type.

CONCEPT.LABEL: mind
CONCEPT.DEF: Something agents must have to make decision on its behavior.

CONCEPT.LABEL: simple action
CONCEPT.DEF: No explicit subaction. Strictly speaking, of course, no action is simple. What are defined here are so-called basic actions which are used to compose complex actions such as shopping, reservation of accommodation, travel, etc.

CONCEPT.LABEL: simple phenomena
CONCEPT.DEF: no subphenomena

CONCEPT.LABEL: object state action
CONCEPT.DEF: The change of the state of the object is concerned.

CONCEPT.LABEL: change
CONCEPT.DEF: It is almost the same as "state action".

CONCEPT.LABEL: kill
CONCEPT.DEF: no physical action is sepcified

CONCEPT.LABEL: Time duration
CONCEPT.DEF: Quantity in the time dimension, e.g., the length of a time interval.

CONCEPT.LABEL: qualitative generic quality
CONCEPT.DEF: This takes qualitative values.

CONCEPT.LABEL: quantitative generic quality
CONCEPT.DEF:
It could have either one of the two kinds of values: quantitative or qualitative.
This includes typical/ordinary generic qualities such as mass, length, etc.
Both slots must be a/o, since its instances shouldn't be equal to the corresponding quantity but a reference to the corresponding quantity. See length.

SUB_L.class_const: 定性値 | カテゴリカル

CONCEPT.LABEL: quality value
CONCEPT.DEF: Value of quality. Although this is essentially a role played by quantity, YAMATO doesn't deal with it so for simplicity.

CONCEPT.LABEL: human body
CONCEPT.DEF:
To avoid redundancy, each body part should be defined in the corresponding slots of human body rather than in body part.
Is-a relations between each part of a body(head, eye, arm, etc.) and "body part" are automatically generated by Hozo as well as those between each part and its whole. For example of the latter kinds, head[RH] is-a head portion[RH], head-portion[RH] is-a human body, arm[RH] is-a human body, etc. are generated. These is-a relations are accessible when you use "p-" operator like "p-human body" in a class constraint.

CONCEPT.LABEL: multi-actor action
CONCEPT.DEF: It has multiple actors.

CONCEPT.LABEL: crowd
CONCEPT.DEF:
It has uncontrollable but common intention.
See [Galton 2009] in detail.

CONCEPT.LABEL: passengers getting out of a train
representation-secondary
CONCEPT.DEF: It needs representation, but it is secondary in the sense that the original content exists before going to representation. Information/information-content, knowledge/knowledge-content, intention/intention-content, etc. are defined in the respective obejcts and role-holders of verbs: inform, know and intend, etc.

CONCEPT.LABEL: representation-primary
CONCEPT.DEF: It is a proposition which primarily needs representation.

CONCEPT.LABEL: function
CONCEPT.DEF:
Functional ontology is not incorporated into YAMATO because it is too professional for general readers.
See [Kitamura 2006] Yoshinobu Kitamura, Yusuke Koji and Riichiro Mizoguchi: An Ontological Model of Device Function: Industrial Deployment and Lessons Learned, Journal of Applied Ontology (Special issue on “Formal Ontology Meets Industry”), Vol. 1, No. 3-4, pp. 237-262, 2006. and Kitamura and Mizoguchi: Characterizing functions based on ontological models from an engineering point of view, Proc. of FOIS2010, pp.301-314.

SUB_L.label: 機能
SUB_L.def: Functional ontology is not incorporated into YATO because it is too professional for general readers. See [Kitamura 2006] Yoshinobu Kitamura, Yusuke Koji and Riichiro Mizoguchi: An Ontological Model of Device Function: Industrial Deployment and Lessons Learned, Journal of Applied Ontology (Special issue on “Formal Ontology Meets Industry”), Vol. 1, No. 3-4, pp. 237-262, 2006.

CONCEPT.LABEL: semi-abstract
CONCEPT.DEF: It needs only time to exist.

CONCEPT.LABEL: color_2
CONCEPT.DEF: See color.

CONCEPT.LABEL: being artificial
CONCEPT.DEF: It means not only "man-made thing" but also "agent-made thing" including bird nests.

CONCEPT.LABEL: shape
CONCEPT.DEF: It is not shape as an abstract thing which I call form.

CONCEPT.LABEL: form
CONCEPT.DEF: regular structure like cube, triangle, line, etc.

CONCEPT.LABEL: line
CONCEPT.DEF: specified by determining two points

CONCEPT.LABEL: forest
CONCEPT.DEF: Cluster of trees

CONCEPT.LABEL: autonomy_2
CONCEPT.DEF: See controllability_2.

CONCEPT.LABEL: rationality_2
CONCEPT.DEF: See controllability_2

CONCEPT.LABEL: controllability_2
CONCEPT.DEF:
This is just a common name of its two subclasses.
See controllability.

CONCEPT.LABEL: autonomous mind
CONCEPT.DEF: Mind possessed by animals.

CONCEPT.LABEL: programmed mind
CONCEPT.DEF: Mind possessed by robots.

SUB_L.label: プログラムされた精神

CONCEPT.LABEL: rational mind
CONCEPT.DEF: Mind possessed by humans, hopefully.

CONCEPT.LABEL: arrive
CONCEPT.DEF: The interval in which the instance exists is (indefinite, t_end) rather than (indefinite, t_end], that is, it excludes t_end.

CONCEPT.LABEL: process-centered
CONCEPT.DEF: These are actions whose "change process" is within our interest in addition to the result.

CONCEPT.LABEL: result-centered
CONCEPT.DEF: We are interested only in the resulting state rather than the intermediate states.

CONCEPT.LABEL: Context
CONCEPT.DEF: Any object can be a context in a case where a certain context-dependent thing should be defined, so it is a meta-thing. In short, any whole provides a context with its things to be parts.

CONCEPT.LABEL: behavior
CONCEPT.DEF: It needs no intention of the doer.

CONCEPT.LABEL: action/behavior
CONCEPT.DEF: It needs a doer.

CONCEPT.LABEL: area
CONCEPT.DEF: It is equivalent to 2D spaceR

CONCEPT.LABEL: area_2
CONCEPT.DEF: Not cm**2 but the 2D thing with a quality whose value is measured in cm**2. The 2D thing is represented as "area".

CONCEPT.LABEL: object achievement
CONCEPT.DEF: A state of an object is achieved.

CONCEPT.LABEL: achievement action 1
CONCEPT.DEF: After the process, a state is achieved.

CONCEPT.LABEL: explicit action
CONCEPT.DEF: How to do(way knowledge )is explicit.

CONCEPT.LABEL: object action
CONCEPT.DEF: Action to physical things rather than actions.

SLOT.label: slot22
SLOT.DEF: Physical rather than actions

SUB_L.class_const: オブジェクト | 準抽象物

SUB_L.label: オブジェクトレベル行為

CONCEPT.LABEL: intransitive
CONCEPT.DEF: No object, but the actor is doing

CONCEPT.LABEL: transitive
CONCEPT.DEF: It has operand(s).

SUB_L.class_const: オブジェクト | 準抽象物

CONCEPT.LABEL: productive action
CONCEPT.DEF: Action which needs specification.

CONCEPT.LABEL: perform
CONCEPT.DEF: perform a role in a drama

CONCEPT.LABEL: execute
CONCEPT.DEF: to execute to get outcomes

CONCEPT.LABEL: play
CONCEPT.DEF: to produce sound by playing an instrument.

CONCEPT.LABEL: speech
CONCEPT.DEF: Voice-coded spoken utterance(with voice).

CONCEPT.LABEL: sentence
CONCEPT.DEF:
Sentence has two parts: (1) a sequence of symbols (2) a sequence of words of natural language. Although (2) is dependent on (1), the two are different entity just like clay and vase.
Word locates at the boundary between representation and representation form. Word[RH] is considered as "representation", while "word" as representation form.

SLOT.label: natural language:slot
SLOT.DEF: Word locates at the boundary between representation and representation form. Word[RH] is considered as "representation", while "word" as representation form.

CONCEPT.LABEL: state action
CONCEPT.DEF: How to make the change happen is left implicit and what is mainly concerned with is what state change is intended.

CONCEPT.LABEL: actor state action
CONCEPT.DEF: The change of the state of the actor is concerned.

CONCEPT.LABEL: point
CONCEPT.DEF: size-less

CONCEPT.LABEL: painting_2
CONCEPT.DEF: A painting drawn on a canvas. In other words, painting with a canvas. (see painting)

CONCEPT.LABEL: structure_2
CONCEPT.DEF: Irregular(arbitrary) structure other than regular ones

CONCEPT.LABEL: event
CONCEPT.DEF:
An event is a wholeness type which has unity. It is not Open-ended in the sense that it has specified either starting or ending or middle(pass-by event) events.
It can't change. It is state-less. It is not dissective.
Every existence is an instance of an event. Any object cannot exist without participating in an event. For example, Mr. A, an instance of human cannot exist in the real world as it is alone, but must exist as a participant slot filler of an event/process instance with some action which he might be perfoming at all times.
It is different from an instance of an action which is a process and is a part of an event instance.
It is a bare event that exists independently of human recognition(before recognition).
It follows B-series of time.

SUB_L.label: イベント
SUB_L.def: Every existence is an instance of Event. Any object cannot exist without participating in an Event. For example, Mr. A, an instance of human cannot exist in the real world as it is, but can as the participant slot filler of an Event instance with some action which he might be perfoming at the certain time. It is different from an instance of an action which is a part of Event instance like Mr. A. It is a bare event which exists independently of human recognition(before recognition). "event" is what human recognized and is eventually/potentially informed to others or prcessed in his/her brain for futher inference.

CONCEPT.LABEL: occurrent
CONCEPT.DEF:
Anything existing in the temporal space. See our waterfall paper[Galton 2009] in detail.
All p/o relations here don't mean mereological parthood but mean compositional parthood, that is, mainly causal parts(subactions, subevent, etc.).

SLOT.label: slot2
SLOT.DEF: The constraint must be entity because meta-action needs occurrent as its obeject.

CONCEPT.LABEL: instantaneous event
CONCEPT.DEF: An example is a pulse. It has only one instant event.

CONCEPT.LABEL: 1D space
CONCEPT.DEF: A generic space like the whole 3D space.

SLOT.label: slot2
SLOT.DEF: Concrete 1D spaces, e.g., a line segment.

CONCEPT.LABEL: 0D space
CONCEPT.DEF: A point in a space.

CONCEPT.LABEL: position
CONCEPT.DEF:
This is essentially a point in a space. It only specifies a point in a space just like a clock time does in time space.
Rigorously speaking, position is a role played by a point in a space.

CONCEPT.LABEL: problem-like proposition
CONCEPT.DEF: Something to be solved.

CONCEPT.LABEL: quiz type problem
CONCEPT.DEF: Quations/quizes given to leaners. It needs a solution.

CONCEPT.LABEL: procedure
CONCEPT.DEF: Specification of how to do (solve problems).

CONCEPT.LABEL: completely specified
CONCEPT.DEF: This is like an algorithm which has perfect specification without ambiguity.

CONCEPT.LABEL: partially specified
CONCEPT.DEF: This roughly specified and is used to define tasks.

CONCEPT.LABEL: difficulty type problem
CONCEPT.DEF: It needs to be overcome.

CONCEPT.LABEL: bodily motion
CONCEPT.DEF:
It becomes components of physical actions.
While an actor of an action is a human(agent), that of motion is not a human but a human body.

SLOT.label: slot2
SLOT.DEF: Sematnically, it should be "body part" rather than "human body". This is a good example of "p-human body" which we are going to introduce soon.

CONCEPT.LABEL: action/behaviro/motion
CONCEPT.DEF: It needs a doer.

SUB_L.label: 行為・挙動・動作
SUB_L.def: It needs a doer.

CONCEPT.LABEL: depart
CONCEPT.DEF: The interval in which the instance exists is (t_start, indefinite) rather than [t_start, indefinite), that is, it excludes t_start.

CONCEPT.LABEL: abstract book
CONCEPT.DEF:
A book without sheets of paper.
It needs another component based on the notion of page, but it is omitted here. See "abstract document".

SLOT.label: slot
SLOT.DEF: "p-" operator in "p-X" works as follows: p-X referrs to any part of X.

CONCEPT.LABEL: word
CONCEPT.DEF: The content(meaning) of a word is defined in the subslot of "sentence". This class is defined as just a sequence of alphabets as the representation form.

CONCEPT.LABEL: alphabet
CONCEPT.DEF:
Specification of the line figure(icon) of the letter and, at the same time, it corresponds to sybol itself which is denoted by the figure(icon). I mean not the English alphabet but general sets of symbols.
Philosophically, this is the essential class in the three "alphabet/symobol" classes such as (1)representation, (2)2D icon, (3)proposition. However, the class defined as representation is named as if that is the essential one following commonsense( I mean, common people think what are visible are more important). See document of "a".

CONCEPT.LABEL: content
CONCEPT.DEF: Something born by content-bearing things.

CONCEPT.LABEL: times
CONCEPT.DEF: not clock time but times(how many times)

CONCEPT.LABEL: quantitative quantity
CONCEPT.DEF: This is essentially quantity.

SUB_L.label: 定量値
SUB_L.def: This is essentially quantity.

CONCEPT.LABEL: qualitative quantity
CONCEPT.DEF: Although these are qualitative values, they are essentially quantitative because they are derived from the quantitative values by introducing threshold value, and hence the values are ordinal.

SUB_L.label: 定性値
SUB_L.def: 本来はロールなので量の下位におくのは間違いであるが，ここしかない． 高い，長いなどが「大きい」こと，短い，軽いなどが「小さい」こともここで定義している．

CONCEPT.LABEL: quantity quality value
CONCEPT.DEF: This is just about if the value is large or not, and the values large and small, etc. are defined as its subclass using the techinque of making <role holder is-a class constraint>.

SUB_L.label: slot
SUB_L.class_const: #入出力関係属性 | #定量的属性

CONCEPT.LABEL: attribute_dependent
CONCEPT.DEF: Ordinary qualitative value such as long, heavy, etc.

CONCEPT.LABEL: attribute_independent
CONCEPT.DEF: Attribute-independent quantity such as large and small.

CONCEPT.LABEL: quantity
CONCEPT.DEF:
It is just a quantity independent of what quantity it is of. That is, 10cm and 11cm exist just as it is in the quantity space and are just different. On the other hand, when a thing's length is 10cm long at time t1 and 11cm long at t2, we say the length of the thing CHANGED. The 10cm long of a thing has its identity which persists having possibly different values.
Note that quantity is not specifically dependent on anything, but generically dependent on physical entity.

SLOT.label: slot2
SLOT.DEF: Generically dependent on physical entity.

CONCEPT.LABEL: length_2
CONCEPT.DEF: See controllability_2.

CONCEPT.LABEL: being long
CONCEPT.DEF: The length taking the value of long. It is different from "long" as a qualitative quantity which is only a "value". The similarity between the two comes from the fact that "long" is attribute-dependent.

SUB_L.class_const: プログラムされた精神

SUB_L.label: ソフトウェアエージェント

CONCEPT.LABEL: being viviparous
CONCEPT.DEF: born as a baby

CONCEPT.LABEL: being oviparous
CONCEPT.DEF: born as an egg

CONCEPT.LABEL: continuous
CONCEPT.DEF: Non thresholded. See thresholded.

CONCEPT.LABEL: thresholded
CONCEPT.DEF: This is a generic quality which reflects the maximum or minimum value of a threshold which lies at the boundary of an abrupt change of property.

CONCEPT.LABEL: categorical
CONCEPT.DEF:
This is essentially a value and non-quantitative, therefore, there is no ordering among values, unlike non-categorial values. Categorical quality has typicality which no quantity has.
It is generically dependent on entity because it is always referred to with #operator as a species.

CONCEPT.LABEL: how to be born_2
CONCEPT.DEF: This is not a generic quality, but just a generic name for the two subclasses.

CONCEPT.LABEL: controllability
CONCEPT.DEF: This is a generic quality. See controlability_2.

SUB_L.class_const: 制御可能 | 制御不能

CONCEPT.LABEL: I_O relational
CONCEPT.DEF:
This is a generic quality dependent on the Input/output relation such as conductivity. This is quantitative.
This is a kind of disposition.

CONCEPT.LABEL: basic generic quality
CONCEPT.DEF: See I_O relational. This is just a generic quality.

CONCEPT.LABEL: red
CONCEPT.DEF: Red can have an instance which has a particular wave with a particular frequency. Red_c is a category which has an interval of frequency.

SLOT.label: color:color:slot
SLOT.DEF: It must be specified to properly represent red color, but left unspecified because of lack of knowledge.

CONCEPT.LABEL: binary_value
CONCEPT.DEF: Introduced by one threshold to get two qualitative values.

CONCEPT.LABEL: ternary value
CONCEPT.DEF: three-value system

CONCEPT.LABEL: singleton quantity
CONCEPT.DEF: The value slot must be a/o rather than p/o, since the instance of quantity must be the quantity itself.

SLOT.label: slot2
SLOT.DEF:
Strictly speaking, this slot should be deleted, since quantity is "number"-independent. However, it is necessary in practice. So, we could assume MKS-unit system is employed as default. Anyway, theoretically, what 1m, 100cm, 1000mm and 0.001Km share IS the quantity.
Or, we must invent a new type instead of "number". It must be "quantity". :-)
See quantity representation.

CONCEPT.LABEL: forward
CONCEPT.DEF:
This kind of generic qualities has the same direction of increase of its dimension, that is, when the value becomes larger, then the generic quality gain more strength. The reason is as follows:
When you have a dimension, you can go two directions: to the value-increasine direction and to the value-decreasing direction. Most of such an axes are "named" or "conceptualized" based on the "value-increasing direction". Let's take an example of length dimension. The value-increasing direction is said "long" and the value-decreasing direction "short". The point here is the asix is NOT called "shortness" BUT "length" which implies "long". This way of naming/conceptualization, we call it "forward" way of conceptualization, dominates and seems very universal.
However, there are some exceptional cases in I_O relational attributes. While "conductivity" is a forward conceptualization, "insulative" or "insulativitiy" is not. It is what we call "backward" by which we mean it gains its strength by going to the value-decreasing direction on the axis.

CONCEPT.LABEL: backward
CONCEPT.DEF: See "forward".

CONCEPT.LABEL: color_c
CONCEPT.DEF:
This is the real value of color and is essentially categorical.
See color.

CONCEPT.LABEL: blue_c
CONCEPT.DEF: See red_c.

CONCEPT.LABEL: composite unit
CONCEPT.DEF: Detail structure is not represented yet.

CONCEPT.LABEL: representation
CONCEPT.DEF: Content-bearing thing

CONCEPT.LABEL: change event
CONCEPT.DEF: Step-wise change like switching.

CONCEPT.LABEL: semi-instantaneous event
CONCEPT.DEF: It includes instantaneous event as its main component.

CONCEPT.LABEL: red_c
CONCEPT.DEF: This is an instance and the real value of red color and is essentially categorical.

SLOT.label: color:slot
SLOT.DEF: The two frequencies must be specified.

CONCEPT.LABEL: intrinsically qualitative
CONCEPT.DEF: This is intrinsically qualitative rather than quantized qualitatives.

CONCEPT.LABEL: extrinsically qualitative
CONCEPT.DEF: They are derived from quantitative value by introducing a threshold.

SUB_L.label: 非本質的定性的特性
SUB_L.def: They are derived from qualitative value by intorucing threshold.

CONCEPT.LABEL: generic quality
CONCEPT.DEF:
This is an abstraction of the kinds at the class level. In the use case, it is sometimes referred to with # operator as a class constraint like "#generic quality".
In a common term, it would be called "attribute".
Its instance is not equal to its value. The value itself belongs to "quality value". Its instance is still an attribute which refers to a specific quantity.
Its instnace plays a quality role like length plays one's height as a quality role.
Quality such as one's height, one's weight, etc. are roles, and hence must be defined in the context of respective contexts(entities). Therefore, they are not defined as basic type like length, weight, etc. See "physical" in which a most generic quality is defined.
See YAMATO paper(attached document).

CONCEPT.LABEL: continuant
CONCEPT.DEF:
Anything which persists and can change. in the 3D space.
It enacts processes, thereby it exists in the real world.

CONCEPT.LABEL: non-unitary
CONCEPT.DEF: This is dissective and has no unity. Its portion is of the same type as its whole.

CONCEPT.LABEL: algorithm
CONCEPT.DEF: The content of computer program. See computer program.

CONCEPT.LABEL: computer program
CONCEPT.DEF: Something composed of sentences of programming language carrying an algorithm(specification of how to execute it) as its content.

SUB_L.label: コンピュータプログラム

CONCEPT.LABEL: programming language
CONCEPT.DEF: Not programming language as a kind but language sentence excluding its meaning.

CONCEPT.LABEL: C
CONCEPT.DEF: This is a class of source codes of C rather than C language as a kind

CONCEPT.LABEL: Java
CONCEPT.DEF: The source code of Java rather than Java language as a kind.

SUB_L.class_const: コンピュータプログラム

CONCEPT.LABEL: process_2
CONCEPT.DEF: E.g., sequence of pulses, sequence of conferences, etc. They are processes.

CONCEPT.LABEL: process
CONCEPT.DEF:
Superclass of unit process(process_1) and senquence processes(process_2).
It is dissective and has no unity, and hence it can change.
It follows A-series of time.

CONCEPT.LABEL: number of times
CONCEPT.DEF:
not clock time but times(how many times)
Contrary to the intuition, "times" should not be taken as a generic quality. What should be taken as a generic quality is the pairof "event" and times. That is, "what event happens many times" corresponds to "color is red". For example, "A month which has many accidents" corresponds to "A rose whose color is red".

CONCEPT.LABEL: numbers_2
CONCEPT.DEF: See number of objects. This is just a generic concept for its two subclasses.

CONCEPT.LABEL: times_2
CONCEPT.DEF: See number of times. This is just a generic concept for its two subclasses.

CONCEPT.LABEL: number of objects
CONCEPT.DEF: not numerals but "number" of somethings(=how many things)

CONCEPT.LABEL: numbers
CONCEPT.DEF: not numerals but "number" of somethings(=how many things)

R_CONST.label: sameAs
R_CONST.ARC: being many times$slot2%many times:slot2%number of times:slot3

R_CONST.label: sameAs
R_CONST.ARC: being few times$slot2%few times:slot2%number of times:slot3

CONCEPT.LABEL: high_low
CONCEPT.DEF: This is just a generic concept of its two subclasses that talk about the magnitude of numbers.

SUB_L.class_const: 入出力関係属性 | 定量的属性
入出力関係属性 | 定量的属性
入出力関係属性 | 定量的属性
入出力関係属性 | 定量的属性
入出力関係属性 | 定量的属性

CONCEPT.LABEL: number of cars
CONCEPT.DEF: There are tremendously many kinds of such generic qualites in the real world.

CONCEPT.LABEL: number of people
CONCEPT.DEF: See number of cars.

CONCEPT.LABEL: counting generic quality
CONCEPT.DEF: Counting numbers of objects and how many times an event happens are essential not to individuals in them but to collectives of objects or events.

CONCEPT.LABEL: non-meta generic quality
CONCEPT.DEF: Just ordinary generic quality. See counting generic quality.

CONCEPT.LABEL: counts
CONCEPT.DEF: counts of numbers and times

CONCEPT.LABEL: high_low quantity
CONCEPT.DEF: There is no corresponding generic quality unlike "counts".

CONCEPT.LABEL: high_low_2
CONCEPT.DEF: See high_low. It is just another way of saying high_low. It would be dealt with at the interface level rather than ontological level.

SUB_L.label: slot

CONCEPT.DEF: See counting generic quality.

CONCEPT.LABEL: non-meta value
CONCEPT.DEF: See non-meta generic quality.

CONCEPT.LABEL: deviational quantity
CONCEPT.DEF: value-specified reference(average). Its generic quality and unit is not specified.

CONCEPT.LABEL: deviation_2
CONCEPT.DEF: See deviation.

CONCEPT.LABEL: role_2
CONCEPT.DEF: We have a rich ontology of roles, but it is not incorporated in YAMATO yet. See A Model of Roles within an Ontology Development Tool: Hozo, Mizoguchi R., Sunagawa E., Kozaki K. and Kitamura Y., J. of Applied Ontology, Vol.2, No.2, pp.159-179. Sep. 2007 for details.

CONCEPT.LABEL: dependent entity
CONCEPT.DEF: Entity which needs another entity to exist.

CONCEPT.LABEL: large_small
CONCEPT.DEF:
This is an auxiliary concept introduced for defining larger and smaller values. Qualitative values such as long, short, larege, small are defined as role-holders.
Note that the two "thresholds" must share the same unit-related representation to avoid invalid comparison such as between those using m and cm.

CONCEPT.LABEL: attribute_independent_2
CONCEPT.DEF: All the subclasses are created for playing the role of context to define "large" and "small" values.

CONCEPT.LABEL: measure
CONCEPT.DEF: This transforms the real quality into a representation, that is, a composition of a representation form like 1.3m or 130cm and quantity as a proposition.

SUB_L.class_const: オブジェクト | 準抽象物

CONCEPT.DEF: e.g., 180cm long It is not realistic to prepare all the possible values to make them a property. So, no subclass is elaborated but one.

CONCEPT.LABEL: equivalence
CONCEPT.DEF: This is a first result of the attempt to make descriptions interoperable.

CONCEPT.DEF: This transforms a quantity as a proposition into quantity representation. It has subclasses other than length quantity representation.

CONCEPT.DEF: This just for differentiating unit-realted form.

CONCEPT.LABEL: cm length form
CONCEPT.DEF: m,cm,km,etc. are kind of form-oriented dimension. "cm" must be defined like this.

CONCEPT.DEF: incomplete. the same as the length must be done.

CONCEPT.LABEL: feature
CONCEPT.DEF: It includes things such as holes and edges which are dependent on one or more independent entities.

CONCEPT.LABEL: comparative large_small
CONCEPT.DEF: This is a sample for two pairs of large_small values for coping with "a small elephant is larger than a large ant" problem.

CONCEPT.DEF: Its existence depends not on a particular individual but on generic class of physical objects, that is, 1m long can exist until all physical objects which have the lengh disappear.
